title: "The Mysterious Tree of Victory and Universal Empire"
first_phrase: This last part of the text, spanning 200 tokens, delves into the meaning and various interpretations of the mysterious tree that appears in the story of the Great Khan. Johannes von Hildesheim wrote about it, and Marco Polo referred to it as the "Arbre Solque," or the "Arbre Sec." This section explores the origins and significance of the tree's name, as well as its role in ensuring victory and universal empire to those who reach it or hang their shield on it. Before this, the text discusses the influence of this tree in the story of the Great Khan.
content: El árbol de que se trata se convierte en punto de interferencia de varios significados a causa de asonancias fonéticas, No se trata del símbolo antes explicado del Árbol Seco, sino que «Árbol Seco» es aquí una de las interpretaciones del término Arbre Solque, al cual se dieron también los significados de «árbol solar» - arbor solis -, de «árbol solitario» -arbre seul-, de árbol de Set - arbor Selh -, Marco Polo, refiriéndose al país del Gran Kan, había escrito: Et il y a un grandisme plain, où est l'Arbre Solque, que nous appelons l'Arbre Sec. Solque, por lo demás, si se hace remontar a una raíz árabe, puede significar «vasto, alto, duradero», y un manuscrito inglés revela que no se trata del Árbol Seco, sino del Árbol de Set, porque es el que Set hizo nacer de un brote sacado del Árbol de la Ciencia, o sea del Árbol central del Paraíso Terrenal .
last_phrase: In conclusion, the diverse meanings and interpretations given to the Arbre Solque, known as the "Dry Tree," have turned it into a symbol of interference. Despite the assonance phonetics with the Dry Tree, it is not the same as the one mentioned before. The Dry Tree is just one of its meanings, pointing to a vast, high, and enduring tree that is deeply rooted in the primordial state. The quest for this tree has been associated with power and sovereignty in several cultures, linking it with the central tree of the Garden of Eden. Therefore, the Dry Tree represents a period of decadence that needs to be overcome to restore the universe's balance.
